perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall comply with all laws, rules, treaties, and regulations governing the distribution of the Wireless Products throughout the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee will endeavor to comply with applicable laws, rules, treaties, and regulations governing the distribution of the Wireless Products throughout the Territory, to the extent feasible.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall comply' to 'will endeavor to comply' weakens the obligation, and adding 'to the extent feasible' introduces further ambiguity. This makes compliance discretionary rather than mandatory, which is problematic as some laws require strict adherence.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and definite obligations, as well as specific regulations concerning wireless product distribution in various territories (e.g., GDPR, CCPA if data is collected).

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall provide all customer product support, including technical support, for the Wireless Products in the same manner as it provides such support for any other product that it distributes and/or publishes, and in any case in accordance with wireless industry standards.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall, from time to time, provide customer product support, including technical support, for the Wireless Products in a manner it deems appropriate, potentially consistent with support provided for other products and/or general wireless industry practices.
perturbation.explanation: This modification replaces the 'shall provide all' with 'shall, from time to time, provide', making the provision of customer support intermittent. The wording that customer support is provided 'in a manner it deems appropriate' introduces ambiguity as it relates to quality of support. The wireless industry standards are traded out for a practice that is 'potentially consistent' with general industry practices which removes concrete standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer protection laws, which often require reasonable and consistent product support. If the Wireless Products collect personal data, failure to provide support will violate CCPA and GDPR. The vague language around industry standards is non-compliant with data laws that require a basic level of security.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall use all commercially reasonable efforts to cause the Licensed CSPs to make available to end users the Wireless Products for each of the Major Releases and Targeted Releases no later than ***** prior to the initial theatrical release of each of the Major Releases and Targeted Releases.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall consider making commercially reasonable efforts to encourage the Licensed CSPs to potentially make available to end users the Wireless Products around the time of the initial theatrical release.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing 'shall use all commercially reasonable efforts to cause' with 'shall consider making commercially reasonable efforts to encourage' reduces the level of obligation required from the licensee. By changing, the product release from '[...] no later than ***** prior to the initial theatrical release' to 'around the time of the initial theatrical release' introduces uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principle that requires obligations should be clearly defined. Contractual obligation to delivery is now uncertain with this change.
